news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Polar Night Energy has secured €7.6 million in seed funding to advance its sand battery technology. The investment will support growth in sales and R&D teams, enhancing the company's capabilities in energy storage solutions.

org_similarity_summary.insight_similar_orgs: Polar Night Energy, Alphabet Energy, Renergen Limited, Electriq Power, and OMC Power are all involved in the renewable energy sector. Polar Night Energy focuses on heat storages, while Alphabet Energy and Renergen Limited specialize in waste heat recovery and renewable energy generation. Electriq Power provides smart home battery storage solutions, and OMC Power extracts clean energy from the sun.

properties.growth_insight_description: Polar Night Energy successfully closed €7.6 million in seed funding to scale up its sand battery technology. The company received investments for its sand battery project in Pornainen.

about_short_description.short_description: Polar Night Energy is a startup that designs and builds heat storages for renewable energy.

product.name: High Temperature Heat Storages
product.description: Polar Night Energy designs and builds heat storages that store electricity as heat in sand, which can be used for district heating networks.

product.name: Feasibility Study
product.description: Investigates how a high temperature heat storage would operate as part of an energy system and determines an optimal design for the heat storage.

product.name: Storage-as-a-Service
product.description: Offers a thermal energy storage with heating power as a service for heating, process steam, cooling, and electricity.

product.name: Heat Storage 2 MW
product.description: A mid-sized thermal energy storage solution with 2 MW heating power and a capacity of 200 MWh.

product.name: Heat Storage 10 MW
product.description: A large thermal energy storage solution with 10 MW heating power and a capacity of 1000 MWh.

product.name: Sustainable Energy Consulting
product.description: Provides consulting on selecting components and tailoring them to a sustainable energy system.
